Package frc.team1711.swerve.subsystems

Class SwerveWheel

  • java.lang.Object
    • frc.team1711.swerve.subsystems.SwerveWheel
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutoSwerveWheel
    public abstract class SwerveWheel
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class used by SwerveDrive to represent a module. Each SwerveWheel contains a wheel which can steer in any direction and drive forwards or backwards.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SwerveWheel()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected boolean checkWithin180Range​(double direction, double marginOfError)
      Does the same check as checkWithinRange(double, double), except it will also return true if the wheel's current steering direction is within the range centered at 180 degrees away from the target steering rotation.
      protected boolean checkWithinRange​(double direction, double marginOfError)
      Checks whether or not the wheel's current steering direction is near a certain direction, with a specified margin of error.
      abstract double getDirection()
      Gets the current steering direction, in degrees, on the interval [0, 360).
      protected abstract void setDirection​(double targetDirection)
      Sets the target steering direction of the wheel on the interval [0, 360), where zero degrees is directly forwards and an increase in direction indicates a further clockwise target direction.
      protected abstract void setDriveSpeed​(double speed)
      Sets the drive speed of the wheel on the interval [-1, 1].
      protected void steerAndDrive​(double targetDirection, double speed)
      Sets the drive speed of the wheel, along with the target steering direction of the module.
      void stop()
      Stops all movement.
      protected abstract void stopSteering()
      Immediately stops all steering movement.

    • Method Detail

      • setDriveSpeed

        protected abstract void setDriveSpeed​(double speed)
        Sets the drive speed of the wheel on the interval [-1, 1].
        Parameters:
        speed - The drive speed
        See Also:
        steerAndDrive(double, double)

      • stopSteering

        protected abstract void stopSteering()
        Immediately stops all steering movement.

      • steerAndDrive

        protected final void steerAndDrive​(double targetDirection,
                                   double speed)
        Sets the drive speed of the wheel, along with the target steering direction of the module. The drive speed of the wheel should be on the interval [0, 1]. A target steering direction of 0 degrees should correspond with moving directly forward, where an increase in target steering direction corresponds with a clockwise movement in target steering direction (from a top-down point of view).
        Parameters:
        targetDirection - The target steering direction, as specified above
        speed - The drive speed of the wheel
        See Also:
        setDriveSpeed(double), setDirection(double)

      • getDirection

        public abstract double getDirection()
        Gets the current steering direction, in degrees, on the interval [0, 360). A direction of zero corresponds with directly forwards on the robot, and as the direction increases, the steering direction is further clockwise from a top-down view.
        Returns:
        The steering direction of the wheel
        See Also:
        setDirection(double)

      • setDirection

        protected abstract void setDirection​(double targetDirection)
        Sets the target steering direction of the wheel on the interval [0, 360), where zero degrees is directly forwards and an increase in direction indicates a further clockwise target direction.
        Parameters:
        targetDirection - The target steering direction
        See Also:
        getDirection(), steerAndDrive(double, double)

      • checkWithinRange

        protected boolean checkWithinRange​(double direction,
                                   double marginOfError)
        Checks whether or not the wheel's current steering direction is near a certain direction, with a specified margin of error. Both direction and marginOfError are measured in degrees. marginOfError must be on the interval (0, 360). A direction of zero corresponds with directly forwards on the robot, and as direction increases, the target steering direction moves clockwise from a top-down view.
        Parameters:
        direction - The steering direction to check against
        marginOfError - The acceptable margin of error, above or below direction
        Returns:
        Whether or not the current steering direction is within the target range.
        See Also:
        checkWithin180Range(double, double)

      • checkWithin180Range

        protected boolean checkWithin180Range​(double direction,
                                      double marginOfError)
        Does the same check as checkWithinRange(double, double), except it will also return true if the wheel's current steering direction is within the range centered at 180 degrees away from the target steering rotation.
        Parameters:
        direction - The steering direction to check against
        marginOfError - The acceptable margin of error, above or below direction
        Returns:
        Whether or not the current steering direction is within the target range.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops all movement.
